title: Dani Chigou
text:
Daniel "Dani" Chigou (born 5 July 1983) is a <a href="Cameroon">Cameroon</a>ian former professional <a href="association%20football">football</a>er who played as a <a href="forward%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a>. In a <a href="journeyman%20%28sports%29">journeyman</a> career, he played for numerous clubs in Italy, Romania, Hungary, the Czech Republic and Russia. He has been compared to fellow Cameroonian striker <a href="Samuel%20Eto%27o">Samuel Eto'o</a>.
Career.
Italy.
He played for eight clubs in Italy in a period of seven years. He began his football career in the 2001–02 season in the Italian <a href="Serie%20B">Serie B</a> with <a href="Ternana%20Calcio">Ternana Calcio</a>, where he played twice without scoring. After moving on, he represented clubs in <a href="Serie%20C1">Serie C1</a> and <a href="Serie%20C2">Serie C2</a>.
Czech Republic.
In January 2009, Chigou signed for Czech club <a href="FK%20Dukla%20Prague">FK Dukla Prague</a> from Hungarian side <a href="Debreceni%20VSC">Debrecen</a>. He made his first appearance for Dukla in a friendly match against <a href="SV%20Wacker%20Burghausen">SV Wacker Burghausen</a> on 17 January 2009, scoring two goals. He opened his account in his second competitive game for the club, scoring a <a href="hat-trick">hat-trick</a> as Dukla defeated <a href="Fotbal%20Fulnek">Fotbal Fulnek</a> by a club record score, 6–0.
In the <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20Czech%202.%20Liga">2009–2010 season</a> he scored 14 goals, becoming the top goalscorer of the <a href="Czech%202.%20Liga">Czech 2. Liga</a> together with <a href="Pavel%20%C4%8Cern%C3%BD%20%28footballer%20born%201985%29">Pavel Černý</a> and <a href="Karel%20Kroupa%2C%20Jr.">Karel Kroupa</a>.
Chigou started the following season, the <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Czech%202.%20Liga">2010–11 Czech 2. Liga</a>, by scoring six goals in five matches and again finished the season as the division's top scorer, this time outright, with 19 goals for <a href="FK%20Dukla%20Prague">FK Dukla Prague</a>. Following the end of the 2010–11 season, Chigou decided not to extend his contract and left the club.
In July 2011, Chigou had a trial at <a href="Belgian%20First%20Division">Belgian First Division</a> club <a href="Oud-Heverlee%20Leuven">Oud-Heverlee Leuven</a>. However Chigou was not offered a contract and found himself back at Dukla at the beginning of the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Gambrinus%20liga">2011–12 Gambrinus liga</a> to train with the club, watching the opening game of the season against Olomouc. On 25 August 2011 it was announced he had started training at <a href="Russian%20First%20Division">Russian First Division</a> outfit <a href="FC%20Volgar-Gazprom%20Astrakhan">FC Volgar-Gazprom Astrakhan</a>.
In February 2012, Chigou returned to the Czech Republic, signing once more for Dukla, but immediately going on loan to <a href="Czech%202.%20Liga">Czech 2. Liga</a> side <a href="FC%20Zbrojovka%20Brno">FC Zbrojovka Brno</a>.
Chigou returned to Dukla in the summer of 2012 but did not feature for the first team in the first half of the season. In February 2013 he had a trial at second division <a href="1.%20SC%20Znojmo">1. SC Znojmo</a>. Despite scoring in a 4–1 friendly win against Austrian third division side <a href="SZ%20Retz">Retz</a>, Znojmo manager <a href="Leo%C5%A1%20Kalvoda">Leoš Kalvoda</a> decided against signing the player.
Career statistics.
"Statistics accurate as of match played 30 June 2012"
